instance.context:
Piper wagged his hand up and down
like a broken automaton .

Rincewind peered around the doorframe and jerked back as a heavy throwing axe whirred past
like a partridge .

On the few occasions when the wind was not blowing a gale , the fog descended
like a shroud .

She had to get them away from the rocks that edged the shore
like jagged teeth .

By the time he arrived at the meeting , the floor was slanting
like a deck again .

Suddenly she came out through the last curtain of trees and found herself looking down over sunlit green meadowland to where a railway line wound
like a serpent through a cutting at the foot .

It was up in an instant and capering after its prey
like an aquatic grasshopper .

Quigley leaped into the air
like a monkey that has sat on a bunsen burner and gave a sort of primal grunt .

One minute he was embracing her , kissing her passionately , and now he was leaping around the bedroom
like a young gallant , getting ready to get out .

THE kind of man who lumbers about
like an injured bear : the quintessential tough guy -- strong , silent and self-con .

Much easier to photograph were the giant tortoises which were lumbering around
like tanks in the undergrowth .

Fish used to lumber and shamble around the stage
like a confused and wounded animal , bellowing out his lyrics as if only this could ease his pain .

Though he had lurched into the kitchen
like a drunken huntsman , he had known what to do .

Kynaston stepped gingerly over the carpet to Harry , prancing on tiptoe
like an inexpert dancer .

Suddenly the penny dropped , and Meredith knew why he 'd been prowling about the airport
like an angry lion .

Candy 's blue eyes narrowed suspiciously as she prowled round Rory
like a tiny bird of prey inspecting its dinner .

` That could be a matter for debate , " she said with curt emphasis , watching him prowl up and down
like a shark testing the boundaries of a tank .

He looked out , only half-focusing , until it seemed the fires were burning in his room , or else his reflection had stepped out through the window to roam the park
like a ghost .

` Why did you rush off
like that this afternoon ? "

Before the school teacher could answer , there was another rap on the door and Beasley scampered in
like an overgrown puppy , casting inquisitive glances at Jim Lancaster and the two police officers .

He was imagining them as they scurried to and fro like rats ,
like rabbits , when farmers burnt the stubble off their fields .

` I never met Barney but I caught sight of the other one once , scuttling across the yard
like a nervous rabbit .

` Good evening , " he said , as I scuttled
like a giant shaved rodent into the furthest corner of the caravan .

They scuttled
like crabs .

RESHUFFLE fever , which had Tory ministers scuttling around Parliament
like hunted rabbits in the days before the ritual disembowelling of Norman Lamont , has been followed by a feeling of severe let-down .

When she returned to the house , she found Sam skipping on the terrace
like a child .

Athelstan glowered back in mock anger whilst she turned and skipped
like a young girl into the church .

Neck rope coiled round his waist , Trent slithered into the river
like a crocodile .

He staggers
like a drunk .

He stamped his feet
like a restless pony , obviously anxious to get back to whatever he had been doing .

Then she saw Gazzer , stamping about
like a loony , feet flying in all directions .

` When he was playing he strutted about
like the rooster in the chicken run .

John was like a new father , handing out cigars and strutting around
like chief turkey in the yard .

Leonie strutted stiff-legged
like a cowboy .

When Irish Tom re-emerged from the best room some minutes later , he was strutting
like a peacock and rubbing the front of his pants in a suggestive manner .

Several of the people that I have dived with have been grossly overweight , enjoyed being so , and are completely at home in the water swimming around
like walruses .

And I gradually began to swim
like that .

The gown slipped soundlessly from her shoulders and she tiptoed
like a shadow towards him .

The kid toddled off
like a drunk trying to balance two pints of beer .

A figure in a raincoat was preparing for sleep in the doorway of George Henry Lee 's , treading round and round on a heap of old newspapers
like a dog at the hearth .

He leapt up from his bench and waddled across the foredeck
like an enormous goose .

Jackson sniffed the air
like an animal taking a spoor .

` Why are you staring
like a zombie ?

Days that were five or ten degrees centigrade in London felt
like minus ten degrees in Denver .

The rivers of Europe and America contain animals that look
like the lancelet , though they are somewhat larger , up to 20 centimetres long .

And can you imagine what the Harris Tweed lounge covers look
like after a free range toddler has snacked and sicked up its holiday treats ?

His apparent rejection of her seems
like the rejection of all mankind .

The dog smelt
like this chair .

It would smell
like a hyena " -- Food Minister Nicholas Soames , after relishing a plate of six-year-old beef , on being asked whether there might , however , be after-effects .

The coffee smelled
like burning oil .

No wonder they 're all as big as hares and smell
like princes ! "

` This smells
like rain , " Zelah said .

` She smells
like a fucking stable . "

This one smelled
like yours . "

She tells them where it is , how far , and in what direction ; she tells them what the food tastes and smells
like , and she also tells them how good a food source it is .

What will it taste or smell
like ?

I am fully aware of what a disengaged starter motor sounds
like , Mr Warwick .

And he had no idea what a dulcimer sounded
like anyway .

Cape broccoli : looks like purple cauliflower , yet tastes
like broccoli .

Do not expect these wines to taste
like champagne .

What we drank then tasted
like sulphur and ox blood ; it set fire to your tonsils . "

What does freedom taste
like ?

His shoulder hurt
like hell .

I was able to breathe only with the utmost difficulty , and my arm hurt
like hell .

All the while , he cackled
like an actor in a bad melodrama .

A handbell in the Bishop 's fist clanged
like a ship 's bell .

I 'm croaking
like a frog . "

That bloody dog was howling again
like a banshee in the night .

The speaker behind my left ear starts to howl and bark
like a dog , and the room shakes with the vibration of rock rhythms .

They walked on all fours , preferred a diet of raw meat , they howled
like wolves and lacked any form of speech .

Ecstatic , the boy tried on one mask after another , roaring like a lion or mewing
like a cat .

Then with a renewed effort I managed to get it to moan
like a person in pain .

He roared
like a wounded bull .

And tomorrow , you could put a drop of oil on that loft door , and the stable one an' all ; they screech
like barn owls . "

The fat lorry-driver on the banquette is snoring
like a pasha .

` They tell me he was squealing
like a pig , " the man said , ` when they put the stitches in . "

At the time , Davide found the two women funny ; they shrieked at one another and squealed
like animals at the slaughter themselves .

Rory could n't help but wonder if he could hear her heart beating , since it was thundering in her own ears
like jungle drums .

The sight of it made him whimper
like a child and fall to his knees again .

It was so high up , it whined
like a fly .

Some whooped and yelped
like savages , others lounged in corners staring wistfully at toys they could never afford .

After being in the sun for some time , my skin feels
like tissue .

Presently a window was opened and framed a sharp white peak which seemed to be hanging almost directly overhead ; it glistened
like a great diamond .

Opposite were the elegant backs of Victorian houses , their grey bricks swelling into bow-windows , the roof-tiles glistening
like wet flint .

The rock face behind them was silvered with moisture and shimmered
like a silken curtain .

She was surprised how bare the gardens had become , except for the lopsided apple tree in the lower orchard whose branches still carried a crop of apples shimmering
like tiny brassy moons .

And as he spoke , El-ahrairah 's tail grew shining white and flashed
like a star : and his back legs grew long and powerful and he thumped the hillside until the very beetles fell off the grass-stems .

It sparkled
like a Christmas tree .

Isobel snapped open her ornate handbag , which glittered
like a chandelier .

In the daytime the view from the huge windows on the south side was smog , but when darkness hid the mass misdemeanours of the city , Los Angeles glittered
like a fairy kingdom .

Her fine red hair glittered
like gold in the watery sunlight .

The yellow skin freckled brown shone
like the well-fingered ivories of a bar-room piano .

If she says anyone 's a head case , she means avoid them
like the Bubonic Plague .

The Profitboss avoids committees
like the plague .

He peeled one glove off and beckoned
like a woman .

He gesticulated
like a scarecrow in the wind .

Rufus gestures for silence
like a compere killing applause .

He must think she was babbling
like a schoolgirl , but there was nothing even remotely schoolgirlish about her growing awareness of this man .

Lucy found herself mouthing
like a mill worker to make herself understood over the noise , which was louder than any machinery .

The water hit her body
like stones .

Soon the chewed mass has sponged up any moisture left and your dry tongue is clanging against the side of your mouth
like the great bell of Notre Dame .

A curtain of water gushed
like transparent silk over her naked form , making her skin appear luminous and highlighting every curve beneath his ruthless gaze .

The broomstick dipped its twiggy end and soared upward
like a rocket .

If , however ,
like Bilinda from My Bloody Valentine you 're singing tender entreaties to your partner or questioning the nature of love , then you 're saying something universal and good .

Just a day after Kevin , 33 , visited his JobCentre , she joked : ` People will make sarcastic comments
like ` She 's done it for the $7 child benefit " .

He stood there , shouting along and flapping his arms round
like an over-excited seagull .

Sighing , Frere flapped his hands at his sides
like a seal .

` He broke a man 's arm a year ago , snapped it
like a dried twig behind his back .

` He was breaking bottles over my head
like a maniac . "

We ca n't hurt her -- humiliate her
like this when she 's expecting to marry him in just a few weeks , even if it has been arranged for family reasons , and not for love .

Grown men should n't humiliate themselves
like this .

They behaved towards each other
like a couple of newly-frozen ice-cubes .

` He behaved throughout
like a perfect gentleman , " cried Fraulein Muller angrily at the top of her voice .

` Chief I hate
like damn to say this to you , but you are a genius . "

When you are competent at flying your model around
like a fixed-wing aircraft , you will find that you are using more and more power until you reach a point where the throttle is fully open .

The candles glimmered on the moon-blanched tree
like Christmas candles .

They were hurled up
like waves breaking backwards into the sea .

He nudged me
like an urchin planning a prank .

ADRIFT : Yachts were tossed around
like toys in the harbour

And so the gulls can absorb or accommodate the pressures of the wind , standing apparently unconcerned in gusts which are tossing around 180-litre oil drums
like playthings .

` Smile , " he said , his voice indicating that he was certainly grinning
like a Cheshire cat .

His hand was shaking so much that the bottle he was holding rattled against his glass
like a window in a thunderstorm .

He 'd washed his hair and piled all his plastic carrier bags into a corner instead of strewing them through the house
like the clues of a treasure-hunt .

He fell in beside her and they began to converse amicably ,
like old acquaintances .

` You get drunk on the Queen 's birthday , and you gab
like an Irishman at a wake .
